title: Cat. 75.1  Ia orana Maria (Hail Mary), 1894/95, published Mar. 1895
publication_title: Gauguin Paintings, Sculpture, and Graphic Works at the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Ia orana Maria (Hail Mary)  
1894/95, published Mar. 1895  
Transfer zincograph on coarse-grained transfer paper, in dark-blue ink on cream wove paper (an imitation Japanese vellum); 380 × 282 mm  
The Art Institute of Chicago, Albert Roullier Memorial Collection, 1921.370  
Guérin 51, Kornfeld 27 B,b  
For the verso, see fig. 75.1.1

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">Albert Roullier (1858–1920), Chicago.

Given by Mrs. Albert (Ella) Roullier (1873–1946) and Miss Alice Roullier (1883–1963), Chicago, to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1921.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section exhibitions" id="exhibitions">Chicago, Renaissance Society, Some Modern Primitives: International Exhibition of Paintings and Prints, July 2–Aug. 16, 1931, no cat., as Vierge et enfant.

New York, Wildenstein & Co., A Loan Exhibition of Paul Gauguin, for the Benefit of the New York Infirmary, Apr. 3–May 4, 1946, cat. 85.

Art Institute of Chicago, Gauguin: Paintings, Drawings, Prints, Sculpture, Feb. 12–Mar. 29, 1959, cat. 140; New York, Metropolitan Museum of Art, Apr. 21–May 31, 1959.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Wildenstein & Co., A Loan Exhibition of Paul Gauguin, for the Benefit of the New York Infirmary, with an essay by Raymond Cogniat , exh. cat. (Wildenstein & Co., 1946), p. 74, cat. 85.

Art Institute of Chicago, Gauguin: Paintings, Drawings, Prints, Sculpture, exh. cat. (Art Institute of Chicago, 1959), p. 80, cat. 140.

Elizabeth Mongan, Eberhard W. Kornfeld, and Harold Joachim, Paul Gauguin: Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints, with assistance of Christine E. Stauffer (Galerie Kornfeld, 1988), p. 130, cat. 27.

</section><section epub:type="footnotes" id="footnotes">His collector’s stamp (Lugt 70), verso, lower right, in blue ink.

According to the Renaissance Society at the University of Chicago exhibitions archive, http://www.renaissancesociety.org/publishing/519/some-modern-primitives-works-in-exhibition/, accessed Mar. 25, 2014.

</section><section id="figures">Cat. 75.1 Ia orana Maria (Hail Mary), 1894/95, published Mar. 1895.

fig. 75.1.1 Verso of Gauguin’s Ia orana Maria (Hail Mary) (1894/95). The Art Institute of Chicago, 1921.370.

</section>
